intro: Beguea betamponensis, commonly known as the Betampona beguea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane rainforests. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
